item.title: What is Tuttle?
item.description: Tuttle is an eXist-db application that adds version control to data collections in eXist-db. It is part of and published by the e-editiones society and can be used by other eXist-db applications such as TEI-Publisher to synchronize data collections between the database and a Git repository. Tuttle wraps the APIs of the Git service providers under a single, common OpenAPI allowing projects to seemlessly add version control to their data.

item.title: Which Git providers are supported?
item.description: Tuttle supports either Github and Gitlab repositories.

item.title: How to configure Tuttle?
item.description: Tuttle is configured in modules/config.xqm in your Tuttle installation. You may use eXide to edit the config.xqm.
